alert.note: Alert for Cooke; Denton (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 03 at 5:58PM CDT by NWS Dallas-Fort Worth
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Denton and southeastern Cooke Counties through 630 PM CDT... At 558 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Sanger, moving northeast at 5 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Denton, Sanger, Pilot Point, Aubrey, Ray Roberts Park Isle Du Bois, Ray Roberts Park Johnson Branch, Road Runner, Valley View, Lake Ray Roberts and Burns. This includes Interstate 35 between mile markers 475 and 486. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
